alert.note: Alert for Knox (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 3:31PM CDT until April 20 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Knox County in west central Illinois... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 331 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Orion to near Monmouth, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Galesburg around 350 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Rio, Wataga, Oneida and Altona. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 34 and 50. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
